Commemorative Stamps Issued
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamps Issued 
    Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Korea Stamp Corporation issued commemorative stamp (one kind of souvenir sheet, two kinds of sheetlets and a kind of separate stamp) on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 The upper parts of the souvenir sheet, sheetlets and stamp bear letters "Celebration of the 60th Anniversary of the Liberation of Korea," "Juche 34 (1945)" and "Juche 94 (2005)".
 The souvenir sheet which includes a round-shaped stamp bearing the picture of President Kim Il Sung carries words of the first stanza of the immortal revolutionary paean "Song of General Kim Il Sung" and depicts Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu.    
 The first kind of sheetlet has a round-shaped stamp bearing the picture of the President and stamps dealing with his revolutionary activities in the period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in which he founded the revolutionary armed forces of Juche after taking over from Kang Pan Sok two pistols, the legacies left by Kim Hyong Jik, beat back the Japanese imperialists and liberated Korea.    
 The second kind of sheetlet contains a round-shaped stamp bearing the picture of the President making a historic speech at a rally held in the liberated country after his triumphal return home. It carries stamps dealing with the historical facts that he met with the workers of the Kangson Steel Works before visiting Mangyongdae, his birthplace, and having an emotion-charged reunion with his grandparents.
 Separate stamps depict the Arch of Triumph and magnolias standing against the background of the nocturnal sky beautifully decorated with fireworks.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Celebrated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Celebrated 
    Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Colorful functions took place in different parts of the DPRK on August 11 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 A meeting of workers and trade union members was held in Wonsan. Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, delivered a report at the meeting to be followed by speakers. They said that President Kim Il Sung beat back the Japanese imperialists with arms of Songun and achieved the historic cause of national liberation by making long journeys of bloody battles during the hard-fought anti-Japanese war. They stressed the need for all the workers and trade union members to give eternal continuity to the revolutionary history of the President, holding him in high esteem as the father of socialist Korea and the sun of Juche.
  A seminar of social scientists took place at the Academy of Social Sciences. Speakers deeply explained and proved the undying feats the President performed by leading the anti-Japanese war to a brilliant victory and achieving the historic cause of national liberation under the uplifted banner of Songun and their significance.    
 Meanwhile, there were a fashion show of national dresses and sports and amusement games of women from across the country.    
 The Ministry of Foreign Trade arranged a film show for members of the economic and commercial councilors corps here at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps.
 The participants saw a Korean documentary film "For the Liberation of the Country" part 15 which deals with the undying revolutionary feats of the President.
 Present at the functions were Choe Thae Bok and Kim Jung Rin, secretaries of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Figure
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Figure 
    Moscow, August 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Vladimir Tolstikov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 The chairman conveyed the gift to the DPRK ambassador to Russia on August 9.

articles.title: Meeting of Young Vanguard Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Young Vanguard Held 
    Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the young vanguard of the Ministry of People's Security was held in front of the old home of leader Kim Jong Il in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu on August 11 to vow their loyalty to Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.
 Seen in the venue were flags bearing the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.    
 Led by Paek Yong Il, first secretary of the youth league organization of the ministry, the participants took a solemn oath to remain intensively loyal to Kim Jong Il.
 They declared they would defend the headquarters of the revolution headed by Kim Jong Il at the cost of their lives, safeguard Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses and the single-minded unity of the revolutionary ranks as firm as a rock and glorify the youth league organization of the ministry as militant ranks which act as one under his leadership and are strong in organizing ability, unity and militancy.
 All members of the youth league organization of the people's security organs will wage a valiant struggle to shatter the moves of the enemies to isolate and stifle the DPRK and staunchly struggle for the reunification of the country and the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation as the eternal companions and Songun revolutionary comrades of Kim Jong Il, they stressed.    
 Attending the meeting were officials of the youth league organization of the ministry and members of the young group for study tour of Mt. Paektu of the ministry.
 Then the participants in the meeting were briefed on the time-honored home of Kim Jong Il in the secret camp before going round the mementoes preserved there with good care.

articles.title: Press Conference Held at Russian Embassy
articles.content:
Press Conference Held at Russian Embassy 
    Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A press conference was called at the Russian embassy here on August 11 to mark the 60th anniversary of the defeat of Japanese militarism in the Far East.
 Present were mediapersons in the city of Pyongyang.    
 Russian Ambassador Andrei Karlov and embassy officials were on hand.
 Addressing the conference, Russian Military Attache Igor Pablov recalled that after defeating the fascist German army, the Soviet army declared a war against Japan in August 1945 and took part in the anti-Japanese battles with powerful armed forces.
 President Kim Il Sung issued an order for the general attack to liberate Korea to the units of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army on August 9, 1945, he said, adding that the KPRA units participated, together with units of the Soviet army, in the final decisive battles to annihilate the Japanese imperialists and won a brilliant victory.
 We pay tributes to the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters and the veterans of the Soviet army who performed heroic feats in the struggle to liberate Korea on the occasion of the significant day of Korea's liberation, he said.    
 Then, answers were given to questions at the conference.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Dancing Troupe
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Dancing Troupe 
    Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting Beryozka dancing troupe of Russia.
 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Mira Koltsova, head of the State Academy Beryozka Dancing Troupe Named after N.S. Nadezhdina, on August 11.
